p: Yellow fever virus (YFV) (family Flaviviridae, genus Flavivirus) is the etiologic agent of yellow fever (YF). In Brazil, the urban cycle has not occured since 1942, but sylvatic yellow fever (SYF) occurs in the Amazon Basin ( S1A Fig) in an enzootic cycle involving non-human primates (NHPs) and sylvatic vectors such as Haemagogus sp. and Sabethes sp. [ 1, 2]. Outside the Amazon Basin, SYF reemerges with an irregular annual periodicity, but with a seasonality pattern, with the majority of cases occurring between December and May [ 2]. It is believed that YFV is disseminated to other areas outside the Amazon Basin by the movement of infected and viremic people or by the illegal traffic of infected NHPs [ 1].
